issues.title: Add Explainability functionality to the Operator Audit Module (Section 3.3)
issues.author: shaileshprabhu95
issues.body:
While the Operator Audit Module lets the Human Operator get an oversight of the LLM Decision with a corresponding Confidence Score, it is also important to include the Explainability (with counterfactual reasoning) aspect along with the Confidence Score.

I propose the following 3 key aspects of the Explainability functionality.

1. **Decision Breakdown**: Each LLM-generated configuration should include a breakdown of key influencing factors. For example, the LLM Decision may also contain "This configuration was suggested due to high network congestion detected in Telemetry Data".

2. **Justification Logs**: Extend audit records to include decision rationales alongside confidence scores. For example:
    - **Decision**: Increase bandwidth allocation
    - **Confidence Score**: 85%
    - **Key Factors**: High latency in telemetry, SLA violation threshold crossed

3. **Counterfactual Analysis**: The system should simulate “What if?” scenarios
For example, "If no changes are made, network congestion will increase by 15% in the next 5 minutes".

Please review and let me know if I can raise a PR to extend the current Operator Audit Module by adding the above-mentioned Explainability functionality. Thanks!

comments.author: xmzzyo
comments.body:
Hi Shailesh,

Thank you for your valuable contribution. I agree that the Explainability functionality is necessary for the Operator Audit module, and I support this enhancement along with the proposed extended fields.

Regarding the counterfactual analysis, do you think we should discuss potential integration with the network digital twin?

Thanks!

comments.author: shaileshprabhu95
comments.body:
Hi  @xmzzyo , thanks for supporting my contribution.

To add the Explainability features to the Operator Audit Module, I've raised this PR: https://github.com/xmzzyo/draft_llm_nm/pull/3
Kindly review!

Integrating Counterfactual Analysis with the Network Digital Twin is an interesting thought. That'll provide a more reliable confidence scoring, and a better simulation scenario. I feel we should discuss this in more detail, hence I raised a separate Github Issue for this: https://github.com/xmzzyo/draft_llm_nm/issues/4

issues.title: Discuss potential integration of Counterfactual Analysis with Network Digital Twin
issues.author: shaileshprabhu95
issues.body: This is a sub-issue of https://github.com/xmzzyo/draft_llm_nm/issues/2 to further discuss the potential integration of **Counterfactual Analysis** (of the Explainability functionality) with the **Network Digital Twin**.

comments.author: shaileshprabhu95
comments.body:
@xmzzyo  - thanks for the idea of integration. I support the integration idea and here's why:

1. The **Counterfactual Analysis just becomes more accurate**. Instead of simply predicting, “If no changes are made, congestion will increase by 15%,” the Digital Twin can simulate the actual network behavior under different conditions before any real-world application.
2. Once validated by the Network Digital Twin, the **confidence score is now based on realistic network dynamics rather than purely model-driven assumptions**.
3. The integration provides an **Automated Feedback Loop for Continuous Improvement.**

Do you think we need a separate draft for the integration? or should we work on extending the current draft with the integration elements?

pulls.title: Enhancing Operator Audit Module with Explainability functionality
pulls.author: shaileshprabhu95

pulls.title: May I join as a co-author?
pulls.author: shaileshprabhu95
pulls.body:
**My contributions to the draft so far**:
- Proposed **Explainability enhancements** to the Operator Audit Module that was well-received (Github Issue https://github.com/xmzzyo/draft_llm_nm/issues/2) and the corresponding PR https://github.com/xmzzyo/draft_llm_nm/pull/3 for text inclusion.
- I intend to support the draft and continue working on these enhancements, including the potential **integration of Counterfactual Analysis with the Network Digital Twin** (Github Issue https://github.com/xmzzyo/draft_llm_nm/issues/4)
- Did an **Editorial Review** of the draft in PR: https://github.com/xmzzyo/draft_llm_nm/pull/1 (merged)

I am deeply interested in the ongoing work of this draft and committed to contributing further to it.
@xmzzyo
